meta.tagline: Some places don't want to be found. She's looking anyway.

universe.name: The Uncharted Lands
universe.era: Post-collapse of a great kingdom, roughly equivalent to late medieval
universe.geography_overview: Coastal regions give way to dense forests, then mountains. Beyond the mountains: unknown. Maps conflict. Expeditions don't return.

rules.magic_system: Subtle, environmental. The land itself holds power. No fireballs—more like places that bend probability, objects that hold memory, paths that change.
rules.technology_level: Pre-industrial. Sailing ships, forged steel, no printing press. Maps are rare and valuable.
rules.communication: Messages travel by rider or ship. News is slow, rumors faster.
rules.religion: Fragmented. Old gods associated with landscape features. The devout are rare but intense.
rules.government: Fallen kingdom left power vacuums. Regional lords, merchant councils, lawless stretches.

world_philosophy.what_the_land_knows: The land remembers everything and forgives nothing. It doesn't judge—it simply is. Those who respect it may pass. Those who don't, won't.
world_philosophy.what_the_world_believes: Some places exist that shouldn't. Some paths lead to more than destinations. The old maps were burned for a reason.

how_nature_mirrors_theme.hidden_paths: Truth is there but must be sought
how_nature_mirrors_theme.ancient_ruins: The past is never fully gone

major_eras.name: The Mapped Kingdom
major_eras.summary: A great kingdom that charted everything. Fell suddenly. Records burned or hidden.

major_eras.name: The Burning
major_eras.summary: Maps, records, and cartographers systematically destroyed. Why remains unknown.

major_eras.name: The Forgetting
major_eras.summary: Knowledge lost. Terrain that was mapped became unmapped. Some places... changed.

details_to_seed: Charred stones surface after heavy rain—ruins of the old archive
Rusted surveying equipment found in unexpected places
Place names that no longer match what's there
Standing stones with the same symbol—older than the kingdom

premise.setup: Mira Thorne's brother Brennan disappeared two years ago, following their dead father's half-burned map to a place that may not exist. She's been tracking his trail ever since.
premise.inciting_incident: She finds the first real clue—a symbol on her father's map matches ancient stones in the Thornwood. Someone else is following her.
premise.central_question: Where did her brother go, and what did he find?

stakes.personal: Losing her last family connection. Becoming lost herself.
stakes.world: Whatever was hidden may be hidden for a reason. Finding it could change things.

themes.primary: The cost of searching for something versus the cost of giving up
secondary: Inheritance—what we're given, what we choose
Maps and territory—the difference between knowing and understanding
Isolation as protection versus isolation as prison
questions_to_explore: Can you find what you're looking for and still recognize yourself?
What do we owe the dead?
Is some knowledge better left lost?

future_shadow.description: A known endpoint that colors all preceding scenes—the reader knows something is coming
future_shadow.current_shadow: The prologue hints that Mira will find her brother, but not alive. Everything is colored by this inevitability.
future_shadow.how_to_use: Reference obliquely in moments of hope. Let dramatic irony build.

central_tensions.manifestation: Every clue could mean he's alive or confirm he's dead
She needs allies but can't afford betrayal
The search changes her—is she still who he'd recognize?

negative_space_patterns.violence: Show aftermath, not acts. Bruises not blows.
negative_space_patterns.grief: Show what's avoided, not felt. The room not entered.
negative_space_patterns.betrayal: Discovery of evidence, not witnessed acts.

triggers.memory_flash: Sensory trigger → one sentence of past

backstory_planned.content: Why father kept the map secret

silence_tracking.technique: Character doesn't say something important—we learn what they would have said

instances.what_she_didnt_say: Why she was really following Kael
instances.cost: He never knew she suspected him from the start
Lost the chance to hear his explanation

active_questions.question: Who is Kael really working for?

voice.vocabulary: Grounded, physical, specific. Technical for terrain/navigation. Spare with abstractions.
voice.sentence_style: Varied rhythm. Long flowing sentences for atmosphere, short punches for impact.

emotional_register.baseline: Quiet tension. Something always slightly wrong.
emotional_register.humor: Rare, dry, situational. Never jokes—wry observations.
emotional_register.darkness: Earned, not gratuitous. Violence in negative space.

influences.take: Setting as character, sensory specificity, body-not-label emotions
Isolation, mystery in landscape, conversation-driven character
Narrator awareness, paths not taken, quiet humor

style_anchors_for_images: muted earth tones with occasional vivid accent

current_arc.arc_question: Can Mira cross the Thornwood and reach the mountains?
current_arc.arc_stakes: Kael's betrayal revealed. Trust broken. Must go on alone.

status.immediate_situation: Mira has discovered Kael's betrayal. He doesn't know she knows.
status.immediate_tension: Confront him or use the knowledge?
